intro: Cusparia obovata, commonly known as the broad-ovate spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are broad and ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface, and it produces small, clustered flowers in the axils of the leaves. Cusparia obovata is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
